Unknown.translation: Just as a barren woman and an impotent man cannot produce children, and churning of water cannot yield butter.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: bMDÎw iesqRI qy hIjVy purK dw sMjog Awid imly qwˆ sMqwn nhIˆ aupjÎw krdI; pwxI dy irVikAwˆ Blw m`Kn iks qrHwˆ pRgt hovy[

lines.gurmukhi: Pn gih dugD pIAwey n imtq ibKu; mUrI Kwey muK sY n pRgty subws hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as a poison of a cobra cannot be destroyed by feeding him milk and one cannot get good smell from mouth after eating radish.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: PxI Px vwly s`p nUM PV ky du`D pIAweIey qwˆ koeI Es dI ivhu nhIˆ imt jwxI; Aqy mUlI KwiDAwˆ mUMh ivcoˆ sugMDI nhIˆ pRgt ho AwieAw krdI[

lines.gurmukhi: mwnsr pr bYTy bwiesu audws bws; Argjw lypu Kr Bsm invws hY [

Unknown.translation: Just as a filth-eating crow on reaching lake Mansarover, becomes sad since he cannot get filth which he is so used to eating; and a donkey will roll in dust even if it is given a bath with sweet smelling scents.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: mwn srovr aupr jy ikqy kwˆ jw bYTy, qwˆ Es dw EQy vwsw audwsI BrÎw hI rihMdw hY; ArQwq Es dw ic`q nhIˆ lgÎw krdw iKMn mn hI rihMdw hY Aqy Koqy nUM cwhy Aqr AMbIr lypIey; pr auh Kyh rUVI au`qy hI muV muV bYTdw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: AwNn dyv syvk n jwnY gurdyv syv; kTn kutyv n imtq dyv dws hY [445[

Unknown.translation: Similarly, the servant of other gods cannot realise the ecstasy of serving the True Guru, because the chronic and bad habits of the followers of god cannot perish.  (445)
